item.title: Blog: v3.0.1: Docker health check is now... healthy.
item.description:
A small bug found its way into v3.0.0. Nothing affecting the core functions of Butler, but as it does support Docker health checks, those should work..

Which is now the case.

No features added, just that bug fix and some minor upgrades to the software components used in Butler.

item.title: Blog: v3.0.0: Enable some REST API endpoints, disable others.
item.description:
As Butler offers a set of rather different API endpoints, there might be cases where you only need some of those features.

In the spirit of security you might then want to enable only the endpoints you actually need.
Butler 3.0 adds exactly this feature.

Configuration is easy. Just enable/disable the individual REST API endpoints in Butler’s configuration file, and you’re done. Done!
